column4: if i have kubuntu and want to install ubuntu-desktop, does it includes all the main progamms as if it is a complete install? with gaim, etc..
yes
not at startup, but at the X login screen
and there's nothing really to "switch", as you'll have programs from both environments listed in your menu, and you'll be able to load Gnome and KDE programs from either
you'll just decide whether to load Gnome or KDE
since, in case you ever want to remove it, you'll be able to, without hunting down every single package
yes, actually, it will ask one or two questions to you
for instance, whether to load GDM or KDM as your login manager
it is
the only really "difficult" thing with having both installed is that you won't clearly distinguish which apps are Gnome and which apps are KDE from the menu
no, you don't, as ubuntu-desktop only requires packages from main
even though enabling universe is probably a good idea anyway
edit /etc/apt/sources.list directly
i'm not sure what you mean, but what you have to do is, basically, add one or more lines to the /etc/apt/sources.list file
for example, my line for Universe is "deb http://it.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu breezy universe"
that's from an Italian mirror though, it might not be very fast for you
but simply adding "universe" to the list of things ("breezy main restricted", probably) in the main line of your sources.list should work
it's in /etc/apt
do "sudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list"
no, actually, you don't have gedit i suppose since you don't have gnome, so make it "sudo kate /etc/apt/sources.list"
make you edit the file of course
or "sudo nano /etc/apt/sources.list", for a textmode editor
